content: associated logical CPs are also affected similarly. Figure 12-8 HiperDispatch Graph for the GP LCP HD Assignments Processor Topology Support The HiperDispatch window shown in Figure 12-7 on page 488, contains most of the information from the Partition Detail Report, plus:  Engines by Weight: Partition Weight % times the number of real CPs in the pool  VHs: Number of LCPs categorized as Vertical High  VMs: Number of LCPs categorized as Vertical Medium.  VM %: Percent of time the partition’s Vertical Medium LCPs are committed  VLs: Number of LCPs categorized as Vertical Low  VL Nvr Pk: Number of LCPs categorized as Vertical Low Never Parked  VL Nvr Pk%: Percent of time the partition’s Vertical Low Never Parked LCPs are committed. When input fields are modified on the Partition Detail Report window, results on the HiperDispatch window will also be updated. Note that when exiting the HiperDispatch window, any changes made to the Partition Detail Report window are not automatically
